snippet.title: Fire rips through 75-storey Torch Tower skyscraper in Dubai
snippet.content:
Fire has ripped through the Torch Tower, a 75-storey Dubai apartment block, one of the world's tallest residential blocks. There were no immediate reports of injuries. the fire broke out on the ninth floor and spread to the upper four floors. "Civil defence and police [are on] the scene now to control the fire," the spokesperson said. The Dubai Media Office tweeted that firefighters from four Civil Defence stations were fighting the fire.
Dubai Police Commander in Chief & Dubai Civil Defence Director General on site following measures to control the fire at the Torch Tower
Firefighting squads from 4 Civil Defence stations have been deployed to bring the fire under control & ensure safety of residents
the fire seemed to have started at the top of the building.
You will now receive updates from
Breaking News Alert
Breaking News Alert
Get the latest news and updates emailed straight to your inbox.
"Smoke is everywhere," the witness said. "The streets are covered in debris." Reports on Twitter say at least 15 storeys are still alight.
Fire seems to be diminishing somewhat. Definitely smaller than an hour ago at this point. At least 15 floors in the centre still alight tho
It is the the building has been on fire. In February 2015, Fairfax Media More to come
